titles.title: Dugger Mountain Wilderness Act of 1999
Dugger Mountain Wilderness Act of 1999
To designate certain Federal lands in the Talladega National Forest in the State of Alabama as the Dugger Mountain Wilderness.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.
Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-422, Part I.
House Committee on Agriculture Granted an extension for further consideration ending not later than Oct. 28, 1999.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 245.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2632.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 7/29/1999--Introduced. Dugger Mountain Wilderness Act of 1999 - Designates certain Federal lands in the Talladega National Forest in Alabama as the Dugger Mountain Wilderness. Gives the Forest Service two years to disassemble and remove from the area the Dugger Mountain fire tower, after which the road to the tower shall be permanently closed to motorized use.
